body.prompt:
Generate a fake conversation between a customer and an agent.
The agent should introduce themselves, their company and give the customer
their name. The agent should ask for the customer's name.
As part of the conversation, have the agent ask for two pieces of
personal information.  Spell out numbers. For example, 1000 should be
said as one zero zero zero, not one thousand. The conversation should be
at least 10 lines long and be complete. At the end
of the conversation, the agent should thank the customer for their time
and end the conversation. Return the conversation formatted 
like the following example:

{'conversation': 
    [
    {'speaker': 'Agent', 'message': 'xxxxx'}, 
    {'speaker': 'Customer', 'message': "xxxxx."}, 
    {'speaker': 'Agent', 'message': "xxxxxx"}
    ] 
}

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Hello, thank you for contacting Mitchell Motors. My name is Carl Mitchell. May I have your name please?

body.speaker: Customer
body.message: Hi Carl, my name is Julie Price.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Nice to meet you, Julie. Can you please provide me your phone number for verification purposes?

body.speaker: Customer
body.message: Sure, my phone number is five five five, two three four, eight nine one zero.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Thank you, Julie. And could you also confirm your email address for our records?

body.speaker: Customer
body.message: Of course, my email address is jprice@example.com.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Great, thank you for sharing that information, Julie. Is there anything specific you need assistance with today?

body.speaker: Customer
body.message: I had a question about the return policy for the car I purchased.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: I'd be happy to help clarify that for you, Julie. Thank you for reaching out. Is there anything else I can assist you with?

body.speaker: Customer
body.message: No, thank you for your help, Carl.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: You're welcome, Julie. Don't hesitate to contact us if you have any more questions. Have a great day!
